example.text: In the last two days, US Border Patrol has seen the highest daily illegal crossing totals EVER — more than 10,000 per day. These numbers will only rise as Title 42 ends tomorrow. Biden has no plan to address this crisis.

Farm Bill Roundtables Hello, friends - I would like to invite you to join me next week for several in-person Farm Bill listening sessions. This is a great opportunity for the farmers, ranchers and foresters of Alabama's Second Congressional District to share what could be include, excluded or amended as the House Committee on Agriculture moves toward a Farm Bill reauthorization.

With the mandate removed, I was able to vote yes on the bill which included a 4.6% raise for service members. Respecting religious freedom I voted against the "Respect for Marriage Act," because it is a gift to radical progressive activists who are hostile to Americans of faith.

Biden barely gave lip service to the border crisis, historic inflation, record crime, skyrocketing energy costs, and our collapsing geopolitical standing instigated by his weak diplomacy and foreign policy blunders - most recently, allowing a Chinese spy balloon to traverse the continental United States. He did not outline a plan to address our economic struggles or the porous border allowing fentanyl into our communities, nor speak meaningfully about our continued subsidization of the war between Russia and Ukraine.

In the last two days, US Border Patrol has seen the highest daily illegal crossing totals EVER — more than 10,000 per day. These numbers will only rise as Title 42 ends tomorrow. Biden has no plan to address this crisis.

He did not outline a plan to address our economic struggles or the porous border allowing fentanyl into our communities, nor speak meaningfully about our continued subsidization of the war between Russia and Ukraine.

Opposing last-minute reckless spending Instead of the timely consideration and passage of twelve separate appropriations bills, Congress punted the FY2023 spending bill until the lame-duck session by passing legislation extending previous spending levels past the original September deadline until this month. I voted no on the $1.7 trillion package projected to increase our deficit by $2.65 trillion over the next ten years.
